acute_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Acute

acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: Based on the absence of mortality at doses of 2,000 and 4,000mg/kg observed in the dermal studies with rats (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1984)).

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.hazard_name: Acute toxicity Inhalation: Dusts and mists
acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.rationale: Based on the rat LC50 (inhalation route) value of 1.26mg/L (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1986)).

acute_toxicity_inhalation_gas.rationale: Due to the fact that the substance is a solid according to the GHS definition and inhalation of its gas is not expected.

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: Based on the rat LD50 (oral route) value of 1,510m/kg (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1984)).

carcinogenicity.rationale: There was no treatment-related evidence of tumor formation observed in 2-year (rats) and 18-month (mice) carcinogenicity studies (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1986)).

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Long-term

corrosive_to_metals.rationale: Test methods applicable to solid substances with melting point of >55degC are not available (melting point: 215-218degC (ammonium salts) (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data), 229-231degC (free acid) (Merck (13th, 2001))).

explosives.rationale: Containing no chemical groups with explosive properties

flammable_gases.hazard_name: Flammable gases including chemically unstable gases
flammable_gases.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

flammable_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

gases_under_pressure.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: Based on negative data on reverse mutation tests in vitro (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1986, 2001)) and in vitro chromosome aberration tests  (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1986)), and micronucleus tests on mouse bone marrow cells in vivo (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (2004)).

oxidizing_gases.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_solids.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data, though being organic compounds containing oxygen (but not chlorine and fluorine) bound to the elements other than carbon and hydrogen

pyrophoric_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

reproductive_toxicity.rationale: Based on no evidence of adverse effects on reproduction and offspring development in rat reproduction studies and rat/rabbit teratogenicity studies, reported in Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1986).

self_reactive_substances.rationale: Containing no chemical groups with explosive or self-reactive properties

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: In rabbit eye irritation tests, the affected animals exhibited the highest Draize score of 1 (conjunctival redness noted at 24 hours); the reactions resolved within 48 hours (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1986)).

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: Based on the evidence of only slight irritation reactions (a mean Draize score of 0.2), which cleared up by 72 hours, observed in rabbit skin irritation tests (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1984)).

skin_sensitizer.rationale: No skin sensitizing potential was found in guinea-pig skin sensitization studies, reported in Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1986).

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.classification:
Not classified (Ammonium salts),
Classification not possible (Free acid)
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures which, in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: Stable to water (water solubility: 500g/L or greater (ammonium salts) (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data)). As for free acid, classification is not possible due to lack of data.

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: In rat subacute toxicity studies, reduced body weight gains associated with decreased food consumption, and increased kidney weight were seen. However, classification is not possible since no other general symptoms or pathological findings were reported (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1986)).

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_statement: May cause damage to organs (nervous system)
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: In rat single dose toxicity studies, clinical signs and symptoms including passivity, impaired sense of equilibrium, prone/lateral position, tremors and convulsions were reported (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1984)). These effects were observed at dosing levels within the guidance value ranges for Category 2.
